summary: Elizabeth C Feeley was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from December 1977 to March 1979. These documents list her name, position, salary, and pay period earnings. The documents indicate her continued employment with the committee throughout its operational period.
significance: Elizabeth C Feeley's significance lies in her role as an employee of the HSCA, contributing to the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify her exact role, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates her involvement in the committee's operations.
